Who does he turn into?

1122.content: How does Shirou become Rin?
1122.title: Rin Tohsaka

1123.content: Who else does he turn into?
1123.title: Someone Else

11231.content:
Shirou had done it. He hated himself for it, but he killed Shinji. He was closer to becoming a Hero of Justice!

Seeing Rin, he ran to her to tell that Rider had been defeated. But she remained silent. “Rin!” he called out to her. “What happened to-“

He stopped, his blood running cold at the sight before him. Cradled in Rin’s lap was the lifeless body of Sakura. Her eyes were glassy like Shinji, now a lifeless marionette. “Shirou ... Sakura’s ... dead,” she said as tears began streaming onto her dead sister’s bodies.

A single sob tore through the silent school as the Holy Grail War ticked another in the deaths toll.

Later

Zouken stares at the body of his now dead granddaughter, Shinji’s body already being turned into food for the worms. “Well, that’s just a waste of decade. Then again, if she couldn’t even survive a weakened Noble Phantasm, perhaps it is better to learn now.”

“SHUT UP!” screamed a restrained Rider. Although barely tangible, she still existed as Crest Works continued to provide mana to sustain the weakened Servant. “You know nothing about her! She SUFFERED for you, and you would toss her aside!? All because of that waste of skin you allowed to command me!?”

Zouken was about to retort on how it would not matter if either grandchild was a master, he stopped as inspiration struck. “Is that so? You believe that if Sakura were your master for the war, you would succeed? Even knowing that she gave you up to Shinji without a fight?”

“I would bet my life on it,” she snarled as she struggled against her bonds, the artificial Command Seals restraining her holding her in place.

A dry laugh met her claim. “Well now, isn’t this interesting? With a proper master you would win the Holy Grail? Then you’ll have it! I’ll even allow Sakura a second chance to be a proper master, since I’m feeling generous!”

Hidden behind her blindfold, Rider’s eyes were wide with shock. “But how would you-“

Zouken held up a hand to silence the Servant, the bonds enforcing his will. “I have my methods dear Rider. Your beloved master will be reunited with you in time. But first, we must address your failure.” Tapping his cane, a multitude of worms began to crawl to Rider. Even as she squirmed more desperately, the worms began to comer closer. “Since you were unable to be the guardian of of legend, the Matou will settle for the beast. Just still and let the worms do their work. It will only sting for awhile!”

With a harsh laughter, Rider began to scream as the worms burrowed into her to corrupt her further.
11231.title: Sakura Matou

112311.content:
It had all fallen apart in the span of a few days. Shirou, having managed to stop Shinji, was deeply troubled by his failure to save Sakura. Rin, dealing with the death of Sakura, had completely shut herself off. And without her help, Saber had fallen under the sway of Caster due to the use of Rule Breaker.

Slowly rising from his futon, Shirou knew he had to fight. But felt a level of frustration at being unable to confront Caster. Getting dressed, he was going for a long walk to think. Going into the area he knew where Rin lived, he inadvertently passed by the Matou estate.

“Well, now isn’t this an interesting surprise?”

Shirou turned around to see an frail old man walking from the old building. “I’m sorry, but you are-“

“Zouken Matou, my dear boy! Sakura and Shinji told me much about you Shirou Emiya! Such as shame about their ... unfortunate passing, though,” he ended with a frown.

Shirou bowed before the man, manners long since ingrained kicking in. “A pleasure, Zouken-San. I’m sorry about the loss of your family. If I had only been-“

A simple tap of his cane silenced Shirou as Zouken studied the boy. “It was rather unfortunate that they both passed. But worry not, as I don’t hold you responsible for Shinji’s deplorable actions.”

Shirou looked surprised, and slightly suspicious, of Zouken’s response. “I am thankful that you do not hold accountable. But ... shouldn’t you have known about Shinji and his agenda. He is ... was your grandson?”

Zouken gave a false interested thought, then continued. “You are correct. I did try to curb Shinji’s more... disturbing habits. But there is only so much I could do. He ultimately took it upon himself to set about his own plans for the Holy Grail. And he paid for it with his life. The real tragedy was the fate of my dear granddaughter Sakura.”

Looking confused, Shirou had to ask. “Did ... did Sakura know about the moonlit world?” he whispered, assuming that Zouken understood what he implied.

Zouken gave a hoarse laugh. “But of course! And there lies the problem I know face. She was my designated heir for the Matou.” Looking at a shocked Shirou, he continued. “Regrettably, she was not ready to take on the responsibility of heading the Matou. This is why I allowed Shinji to command Rider, since it would ease her burden while giving Shinji a chance to prove himself like always wanted. But alas, with their deaths, I am left without an heir to pass on my knowledge.”

Shirou was saddened by the news of the Matou’s fate. “I’m sorry sir. I know losing Sakura and Shinji must hurt very deeply. If their is anything I can do to help-“

“It’s fine my boy. The Matou will live on in some manner, although to what extent I know not. I’m sorry for wasting your time my boy. Thank you for at least humoring old man.” With that Zouken, turned to walk back to his house.

Shirou, filled with regret and shame, muttered under his breath. “If only I could have saved Sakura, then I would have been able to save everyone.”

Looking back at the boy who had stepped into his web, Zouken gave a mock look of intrigue. “Save Sakura you say? Young man, such things are normally impossible. But with the Holy Grail, the revival of life is trifle as a wish.”

Shirou met Zouken’s gaze. “I would, but my servant Saber was lost to me. An enemy servant took control of her, and I have no allies to rely on.”

Zouken strokes his chin in thought, tempting him further. “That would normally be true. But with another servant, you would at least stand a chance of reclaiming your true servant. And luckily for us, I happen to know of a way to provide you with said servant.”

Shirou was surprised by that remark. “But how?”

“My dear boy! The Matou, formerly Makiri, helped build the system that supports the Grail. My ancestor, Zolgen Makirir, left notes and his personal journal behind. Using this, I managed to save Rider, but at great cost. With the death of Sakura, the former bonds have affected her mind greatly. She is now closer to the Gorgon than she normally would be. But, if someone close to Sakura were to guide her, there is still a chance of her avenging my dearly departed Sakura. But alas, I’m too weak in my old age.”

Shirou immediately stepped up. “I can do it sir. If you allow me to use her, I can use Rider to reclaim Saber. And then, I’ll use my wish to revive Sakura for you. I swear it!”

Zouken looked conflicted, but was cackling on the inside. “I wish I could, but the only way to bond Rider is through the Matou family crest. And only my heir can receive it.” Thinking on it, Zouken drew him in further. “Unless I were to pass on the crest to you. But that would be asking too much of you, my dear boy,” he mused, aware that Shirou was almost caught.

“But sir, I would be more than willing! I know that magic crests are sacred to a family lineage, but at least let me try! If nothing is done, the servant Caster will win the war! And then, she’d be free to reek havoc on the world with the Grail. I’ll do anything you ask of me!” Bowing his head, Shirou pleaded. “Please, just give me a chance!”

With that, Zouken’s plan was sealed. “So you wish to atone and save my granddaughter and Fuyuki from servant Caster, eh? Very well, young Shirou! The transplant you will undergo will be harrowing, but I will try. Come along, we can begin now if you wish.”

Shirou followed the beckoning of the old man, unaware of the hell he’d agreed too.
112311.title: Later

1123111.content:
Pain. All he felt was pain. After agreeing to follow Zouken, everything was a blur. He felt a stinging bite, a searing pain, and ... his skin crawling?

“SHIROU! Shirou, my boy! Can you hear me? Nod if you understand!”

Hearing Zouken’s wheezing voice, Shirou weakly nodded.

“Good! Good! I thought the shock off the transplant did you in. But no matter, the transplant was a success! After you recover, we can begin training you to control Rider,” he finished.

Shirou groaned weakly. “What ... day... is it?”

Zouken clicked his tongue in annoyance. “It took a week to make sure the crest would not reject the transplant. Thankfully, you should be ready by tomorrow to begin.” Seeing him shift weakly, he snapped at him. “Do not strain yourself, my boy. Rest, for you have a lot to learn very quickly.”

Nodding weakly, Shirou blinked slowly, his purple hair and eyes making eye contact.
1123111.title: One week later

11231111.content:
Though everything was still a blur, Shirou could still remember bits and pieces of what he’d gone through.

The worms. Oh God. The Worms. Even if it was necessary to carry the Matou crest, Shirou felt nothing but pity for Sakura. The worms left no part of his body alone. Continuously feasting on mana and writhing in the pit.

He even thought that Zouken had been chuckling in the background. But it didn’t matter. He endured as he had in the past. In order to be a hero.

“How are you feeling my boy?” Zouken inquired as he walked into the room. “You’ve surprised me. The training has been known to consume those of ... questionable constitution. My poor son Kariya was one such case, and was consumed during the Fourth Grail War. But you, why you’ve done exceedingly well so far.”

Shirou blinked as he processed what Zouken was implying. “So... Sakura went through all of this? Isn’t their an easier way? I mean, I definitely feel different. But the worms... they’ve been changing me? I don’t feel like I used to. I can barely move, and the pain makes it hard to process things,” Shirou admitted.

“Sadly, it is the nature of Matou magecraft that we use the crest worms. In order to use our knowledge of familiars fully, we bond ourselves to the worms in order to practice our craft. The pain and changes that follow are the body adapting to better use the crest worms,” Zouken explained while studying Shirou.

Zouken stared at his newest ‘project’ with pride. It was truly surprising the way the boy had adapted to the training. The discovery of Avalon and that untapped Reality Marble certainly helped stabilize him during his first few dips into the pit. It was necessary to integrate the worms he harvested from Sakura. Especially with the latter stages of his plan.

“But no matter. While you have done well to adapt to the worms, we must move on.” Tapping his cane, Zouken released a pulse of mana. “Rider! It is time!”

Stepping out of the shadows was Rider. But, far different from what Shirou remembered. Her blindflood was completely destroyed, revealing pink reptilian eyes staring him down. The dress was ripped in several places, and her hands and feet looked closer to claws. “Sa...ku...ra,” was what she growled out, seeing Shirou.

Shirou felt unnerved looking at the way Rider studied him. “Umm, is she going to attack me? She looks like she’s barely restraining herself.”

Zouken shrugged off the question. “It doesn’t matter. The artificial command seals enforce the user’s will over the servant. Horrible, but necessary. Now, let me see your hand.” Shirou complied with Zouken’s command, and a red light flashed as Zouken transferred control to him. Immediately, a brutal flair of pain ran through Shirou as Rider’s bestial mind brushed against Shirou. She crouched low, looking to rip apart Zouken as her gaze met his. “Shirou! Control your servant!”

Flaring his command seals, Shirou gave the order. “Rider! Do not attack Zouken!”

Rider let loose a low growl, but complied as she stood back up. Remaining still, she silently awaited orders.

Zouken took a moment to compose himself, having remembered the difficulty of breaking the servant and subsequent binding was. “Very good. With Rider now under your command, you should be able to use her speed to ambush Caster and her master. With her now at full power, she is capable of combating that teacher easily enough while you use the worms to drain the prana of Caster. Should all succeed, you can reclaim Saber and maintain both servants with the excess prana.”

Shirou nodded as he spoke. “Yes Zouken-san. I will not fail you.” Motioning towards Rider, he pulled on his usual attire from the dresser. “Rider! Take me to the church!”

The servant moved in a blur, picking Shirou up and zipping out the window into the night.

(Note: Consider the story a mix of Fate Stay Night and Unlimited Blade Works.)
11231111.title: After training

112311111.content:
Zipping from rooftop to rooftop, the duo quickly made it to the church. Rider set Shirou down a gently as she could manage. “ Rider, don’t move from this spot until I order you. Understood?”

The pink haired servant nodded, staring ahead at the abandoned building. “...yes... my master,” was the meek response. Taking spirit form, the fallen beast watched her new master walk away. Briefly seeing Sakura’s form overtake Shirou’s, she smiled as he walked into the building.

Once inside, Shirou quickly checked for any movement to indicate life. Finding nothing, he made his way to the door in the back.

Where a loud moan echoed throughout the building. Moving quickly, Shirou made his way to the bottom of the church.

And the sight that met him nearly broke him.

Standing restrained in the middle of a circle was Saber. Held captive in the air, she was panting wildly as sweat cascaded down her face. A sweet scent drifted through the air, causing the crest worms to wriggle furiously.

Nearly screaming in pain, Shirou clamped down as the worms began releasing pheremones. Short hair immediately grew outward to the back of his neck. The face began to mature and shift as it took on a familiar face. Hair receded as his junk shrank, a small but noticeable pair of breasts pushed out.

Looking on her again after the pain receded, he noticed something different about Saber. “Is ... is she younger?”

Acid yellow eyes brightened in glee as a familiar intensity overtook her. Liquid began to drip down the wedding dress of Saber, beckoning her release. As proved too much, she feared her head back in ecstasy.

“Maaaaassstterrrrr~”

She then slumped down as the high wore off.

Does Shirou ____?
112311111.title: At the chruch

1123111112.content:
Sneaking down as quickly as he could, Shirou got as close to the circle as he could. Seeing no one around, he looked at the slight panting form of Saber.

“Saber,” he tried to call out. Getting only a moan in response, he snuck closer and called again. “Saber!” he whispered fiercely.

This finally got the attention of the ensnared Servant. A pair of yellow eyes met his purple as she tilted her head. “Ma-ster?~” she half moaned in confusion.

“Yeah! Saber it’s me, Shirou! I came to set you free!” he answered back frantically.

“Masterrrrr-“ she slurred as another wave of pleasure went through her.

Shirou was about to respond, when a purple light bound him in place.

“Well, well. My sweet boy! Although you really don’t look like one anymore. So perhaps it’s my sweet little doll?” cooed an annoyed Caster.

Gesturing with her free hand, Shirou was placed in a similar position to Saber.

“What to do? What to do?” she asked in a mocking tone.
1123111112.title: Investigate

11231111122.content:
Caster gestured as Shirou struggled against his bounds, drawing him closer to her. “Should I... turn you into manikin for all the dress I’ll make for precious Saber-Chan? Should I... turn you into a weapon to strike down the remaining masters? Or... should I turn you into my new body? Push allll my spiritual essence into you, turning you into the perfect backup so I may persist into the modern day truly?”

Shirou was attempting to draw on the worms to absorb Caster, but they went still as Caster’s spell overwhelmed the weaker magecraft. Thinking quickly, he stalled for time. “You think I came alone Caster? You’ve become such a threat, I had to alert the Magus Association. They’re on the way as we-“

He suddenly froze up as the ability to speak was stripped from him.

“Foolish boy! Did you not think that I kept tabs on you? You came without any help, besides those disgusting worms that old fossil produced, and expected to steal your servant back? HA!” Caster muttered something as she prepared a spell to cast on Shirou.

“Masss-teeeer,” moaned Saber, getting the attention of the pair.

“Yes, sweetie. I’ll tend to you later. But first,” her eyes flared purple from under her hood,” I have a new body to prepare.”

Shirou was channeling whatever prana he could to the worms, desperate to get any response. A purple haze began envelope his body, slowly overtaking his form.

“Take some solace in the fact you’ll be Saber’s master again. Just let go, and it will all be over,” she whispered as her body began to fade.

“MAASS-“

Saber was cut off as a purple and black blur sped by, a chain ripping through her neck. A crimson spray drenched the nearby area as Rider drank from the open wound, lapping up the excess prana of the newly deceased servant.

A mental scream echoed through the area as Caster’s concentration shattered, having witnessed the death of her coveted pet. Right as Shirou’s prana finally spurred on the worms to do their job.

And Caster was basically prana given a vague human form trying to overtake Shirou’s body. The worms immediately latched on to the foreign prana and began to greedily consume the free meal. Shirou’s magic circuits surged with energy as he nearly blacked out.

Consuming the last of Saber’s energy, Medusa watched as Shirou’s body began to morph and shape as the worms further adapted their new host. Shirou’s hair immediately grew to the small of his back, shifting as his spine arched and shifted. His body began to shrink as muscles and calloused skin grew soft and pale. The excess fat was either moved or consumed by the worms into their new homes. Pheromones released by the worms stimulated the creation of estrogen, fully circulating into the soon to be female body.

The last vestiges of his manhood shifted and shrank as they were replaced by tubes and a womb. Breasts began to grow as fat filled and stimulated their growth, filling the shirt as valley of cleavage spilled out from the top. Hips flared as his new ass popped out of the pants, an hourglass figure that women would kill formed.

The feral Rider grinned as the former Emiya took the form of the fallen Matou. “Sakkurraaa...” she purred out in pleasure. Picking up her barely conscious Master, Rider raced off out the decrepit remains of the church to report to Zouken

Speaking of...

The worms congealed into the form of a laughing old man. Glee painted his features as he had the worms assimilate the remains of Saber for future use. “Now this is progress! I should have done this years ago. Now, I only need to deal with those annoying Tohsaka and priest, and all go according to plan!”

Cackling, he returned to his work form as the colony scuttled to meet with his newest project.
11231111122.title: Rider intervenes

11231111123.content:
Caster gestured as Shirou struggled against his bounds, drawing him closer to her. “Should I... turn you into manikin for all the dresses I’ll make for precious Saber-Chan? Should I... turn you into a weapon to strike down the remaining masters? Or... should I turn you into my new body? Push allll my spiritual essence into you, turning you into the perfect backup so I may persist into the modern day truly?”

Shirou was attempting to draw on the worms to absorb Caster, but they went still as Caster’s spell overwhelmed the weaker magecraft. Thinking quickly, he stalled for time. “You think I came alone Caster? You’ve become such a threat, I had to alert the Magus Association. They’re on the way as we-“

He suddenly froze up as the ability to speak was stripped from him.

“Foolish boy! Did you not think that I kept tabs on you? You came without any help, besides those disgusting worms that old fossil produced, and expected to steal your servant back? HA!” Caster muttered something as she prepared a spell to cast on Shirou.

“Masss-teeeer,” moaned Saber, getting the attention of the pair.

“Yes, sweetie. I’ll tend to you-“

Saber twitched as she looked into the rafters. “Master... servant,” she murmured as pleasure rattled through her.

Caster senses flared as she smelled ... a concealment spell similar to what she gave Assassin to hide. Slashing Ruler Breaker down on Shirou, a scream and flash occurred as Shirou lost his second servant to Caster.

A load roar rocked the church as Rider came roaring to attack the two enemy servants. And then a command seal from Caster stopped her.

“Oh! OH! That ... really could have been really bad,” Caster muttered as shock slowly gave way to glee. “Very good, my dear Saber! You’ll get a special reward later!”

Shirou, while released from the bonds via Rule Breaker, was still struggling as the pain of losing another servant took it’s toll. The worms went uncharacteristically quiet as well, as if sensing the severity of the situation.

Turning her attention to the downed Shirou, she knew exactly how to deal with him. “So, you did have backup after all? And Rider at that, a servant I believed to be defeated! I’m almost impressed you made it this far!” she said as she studied the boy turning female.

“Enough to not turn me into a skinsuit?” he asked hopefully.

Only to receive a laugh in response. “Oh! No no no! You’re still gonna be a “skinsuit” as you put it! But, I’ll be generous with your choice. As a last request, you can choose which of the three servants you merge with. It’s only fair since you managed to this far.” Using her magic for a brief second, the feral Rider and horny Saber appeared beside her. “Now choose.”
11231111123.title: Other

112311111233.content: What are his other options?
112311111233.title: Other

1123111112332.content: What class does he become?
1123111112332.title: Becomes another servant

11231111123321.content: Who does he turn into?
11231111123321.title: Assassin

112311111233213.content: More options to choose from are?
112311111233213.title: More Choices

choices: To the Grand Order classes we go
1123111112332333.content: Does she risk another Caster, or wants to rule the Grail War?
1123111112332333.title: Running out of traditional

11233.content: We have more to choose from. Who do we want to try?
11233.title: Other

choices: The summoning circle in the shed.
112332.content: How does he become a she?
112332.title: Irisviel von Einzbern

1123322.content:
"Sorry kid, but I can't have word going out that some random survived getting stabbed through the heart by me of all people." Said the man in a blue as he left the shed.

Shirou Emiya, Third-rate magus, and Hero of Justice in training was currently dying for the second time in one night. The Spearman in blue had narrowly missed his heart, but he was still going to bleed out slowly.

"I...was saved...I have a dream...and obligations...I refuse to die in a place like This!" He barely managed to get out. Unnoticed to him, an old magical circle activated and responded to his wish to live. However, instead of summoning a servant like in so many other realities, something else happened.

Unknown to him, the legendary Sheath of King Arthur, Avalon, was healing him. However, it needed more mana, and the old magic circle had multiple pools of energy it could siphon off of, most notably, an old slightly depleted amount of energy from nearly a decade ago. The old mana was familiar to the sheath, it was the energy of a former host. The activation of the circle allowed the sheath to take the mana from the circle and heal the boy.

Shirou shuddered as the foreign energy from a decade ago slowly entered him, causing him to let out a breath he didn't realize he was holding. As his body and thoughts slowly relaxed, his mind wandered unwillingly to the white-haired girl he met.

"Illya..." He muttered as his consciousness left him. How did he know her name? More importantly, he now knew that she was Kiritsugu's Daughter. If she was his daughter, then that obviously made her his sister right?

Then why did that feel wrong?
1123322.title: The summoning circle in the shed.

11233221.content:
Magical energy soon covered the boy, slowly trickling in from a nerve that was turned into a makeshift circuit.

The slow absorption process caused the old energy to coat the boy in a blanket of magic, this blanket soon became denser as Avalon started to gain power. The sheaths pull became stronger and caused some of the mana to fuse into his clothes, changing them.

The hole in his shirt slowly closed while the blood was changed into a sort of dye that seeped into the rest of his shirt. His pants suddenly cut off at the knees and were bleached white. The leggings swiftly fused with his shoes, forming a pair of white thigh-high boots. The shortened pants combined into a white skirt, while his underwear formed black tights and white panties.

His Shirt had split itself into two parts, the burgundy blood on top, and the white bra on the bottom.

Shirou, who hadn't noticed a thing, was wondering how he was still alive, he felt the pain lessen and slowly disappear while his mind took him away from his changing clothes.

That man was a servant, a Lancer-Class one. He also seemed to be Irish, just like in the last war!

War?
11233221.title: Continue

112332211.content:
Shirou slowly got up as feeling returned to his healing body.

The smaller clothes he wore were uncomfortable, but his focus was entirely on the revelation that he was now involved with the Holy Grail War again(?). Knowledge that was not his own entered his mind at a slow crawl, his own meager skills in Reinforcement and projection slowly switched to a skillful affinity for Transmutation and Healing magecraft.

Shirou wondered what to do. For all intents in purposes, he was dead to the enemy master and no one else should suspect him. It would be best to simply wait in the Emiya Residence for now.

The young Emiya opened the door to the living room and observed the damage. He was thrown around by the servant and the damage was quite apparent. He quickly cleaned it up but paused as he saw something from the corner of his eye.

It was a picture of him and Kiritsugu.

He couldn't help the stabbing pain that entered his heart. It's been so long since he passed, yet, he felt even more pain by looking at the picture than when it actually happened.

The myriad of emotions he felt were stronger than anything he felt before and he didn't know why.
112332211.title: Continue.

1123322111.content:
Shirou slowly started to cry, his tear turned his face pale as they traveled down his cheeks. He rubbed his eyes to clear them of tears and when he was done his eyelashes had grown and his eyes were a ruby red. His adam's apple disappeared as he mournful moan and his throat slimmed.

His whole facial structure became more feminine and smooth. His hair had gained length and currently reached a little past his shoulders. His nose had become smaller and cute, while his lips had puffed up.

When the changes were seemingly done, Shirou's head was that of a mature woman. His head had skin almost like a porcelain doll and he had beautiful red eyes and silky white hair that reached the middle of his back.

As Shirou got a hold of himself, he noticed the strange higher pitch of his voice. He looked himself over and finally motives his new attire, as well as his smooth mane of hair.

"What...What's going on?" Shirou asked no one in particular. The voice of a women now coming from his own mouth.
1123322111.title: Changes begin

11233221112.content:
Shirou ran for the bathroom and turned the light on, what he saw was an albino beauty he thought only existed in anime.

His head was not his and looked to be of European descent. His hair was pure white and his eyes were red, which furthered his albino looks.

He looked deeply into his new eyes and soon, couldn't look away.


His memories quickly morphed as he entered a trance. He was fairly skilled in alchemy, his meager beginnings in his shed we're ejected from his mind completely as a castle in the wilderness of Germany entered his mind. His name wasn't Shirou Emiya, but Rather Shirou Von Einzbern.

The cruel fire that created him was soon replaced with a tranquil creation withing a tube.

A tube? He was Human! Not a Homonculus!

And he was right. His generics and being were still that of a human being.

At least for now.
11233221112.title: He looks for a mirror.

112332211121.content:
While Shirou von Einzbern was indecisive about his identity, the regenerative process of Avalon had already decided.

The part of his chest that was healed over quickly lost its color as it paled. The crawling loss of coloration quickly swept across his entire body, cementing his new existence as a Einzbern Homonculus.

His childhood as a young boy was shifted over to that of a child who was trained by true magic, a child that was generally clueless about the world.

As the pale skin reached his hands, they compressed and shrink until they were soft and dainty, losing the roughness he gained from his handy work and side jobs. The change spread over his arms as they lost muscle and definition, leaving behind smooth slender arms that fit his sleeves. His legs went through a similar process, losing all hair and slimming down until his clothes fit him perfectly. He lost mass in his torso and soon fit his new shirt, with extra room in certain areas.

He looked himself over and soon had a hard time denying his new memories. If he was a human Japanese boy, then why was he not Japanese not was he human? His magic circuits had advanced in quality and far outdid his previous one's, it was simply unnatural for a third-rate mage to have that many with such a quality.

He denied his new memories and focused on what he knew was true, his adoption of a ideal, a dream that was more portent to him than anything. The dream he got from...

Kidiysugu Emiya.

1123322111211.content:
No matter which memories he preferred, both seemingly revolved around Kiritsugu and his dream.

He remembered being raised by him, being taught by him and most of all, learning about his Ideals. The wish to save everyone, a wish that was impossible.

His heart was beating hard as he thought back to all he owed to Kiritsugu. The ache he felt in his chest was not just metaphorical, with each breath, his pecs grew out and filled out his bra and the baggy parts of his shirt.

His thoughts on the man had changed drastically in the half-minute he thought of him. He was a sort of father figure for a time, but soon he became his everything.

An emotion he never felt before hit him, a feeling of lust as he slowly reached for the bulge that had lifted his skirt up.

As he started to touch himself, his other hand had already reached for his sizable chest and began feeling it up. The soft feel of his breasts was like nothing Shirou 'Emiya' ever felt, but for Shiviel Von Einzbern, they had many memories of such acts of lust.

She remembered the war but instead of dying she survived and lived in the Emiya residence since then.

Now the war had come once again, her daughter was at stake and she would make sure she was safe.

During the 3rd grail war, Angra Mainyu corrupted the grail and has since been the main influencer of its power. When Irisviel became the grail her consciousness disappeared for a time, however, it eventually reformed and the grail was soon uncontrollable as she wrestled control from Angra Mainyu.

Now, Irisviel is being forced into Shirou. The only other way to take the grail from Angra Mainyu would be to expel him into Shirou.

1123341.content:
It was a scene like many others in the Fate universe. Shirou sees Lancer and Archer fight, tries to run but can't, and gets revived by Rin. And stop me if you heard this part before. But he gets found by Lancer again, runs out of the house trying to fight and almost die again. Only to be saved by luck as he summons Saber. And life goes on.

But what if something different occured?

Say like, the ritual circle was designed a bit differently.

You summon someone who is the heroes worst fears, for example.

But it has to be done properly. Luck can only take you so far.

Otherwise, things backfire and change. As poor Shirou will attest.

"Hold still you little ... oh no. NO!NO!NO! NOT HER!" Lancer felt an all too familiar fear as someone began to appear.

Shirou's eyes boggled in confusion as the guy who was trying to kill him suddenly looked like he'd seen a ghost.

"HELL NO! I am NOT sticking around for this!" Lancer astralized as the figure.

Shirou jumped up to try and chase after the fleeing man turned ghost.

Only to slip on the pipe he was working on earlier.

He fell into the decidedly feminine figure that had almost taken form.

"Well, well. To be summoned like this. Are you my- WHAT HAVE DON-" She couldn't even finish.

A bright flash of light could be seen from the garage. And then silence.

When Shirou wakes up ...
1123341.title: Scathach (Lancer)

1123343.content:
"Just leave Shinji." Shirou exclaimed, "Your Servant is gone, there's no point in fighting this war anymore."

Shinji Matou, Playboy and, until moments ago, A master in the Holy Grail War quickly took this offer as Shirou's Saber was still eyeing him in a more dangerous way from the way girls at school looked at him.

"Curse you Emiya!" Shinji grumbled in between breaths as he gasped for air from running as far as he could. "He gets the Saber Servant and all I get is a worthless...RIDER GET OUT HERE!" Shinji yelled as he checked the command book his grandfather gave him.

Rider appeared with a gash that nearly cut her waist in two and if one where to look closely, see that she herself was see through from lack of Mana."How useless can you be? All you had to do was rip that Blondie apart and then Emiya!"

Unknown to both, grotesque bugs came from crcks and holes to slowly form a old man who watched the whole battle from his many eyes.

"He doesn't deserve to win, he is basically the schools unofficial janitor! Hell, He'd make a better servant than you!"

The forming of Zouken Mahou halted for a moment.. then resumed as a smile was stretched across his face.

"Boy... you dissapoint me...but you have given me some inspiration."

Shinji had froze In terror then confusion. "W-W-What do you mean?"

Zouken nearly smiled as a special Worm had latched itself to Rider Causing her to fade at a increased rate, while a second Worm latched itself to Shinji's hand.
1123343.title: Rider (Medusa)

11233431.content:
Despite his servants warning, Shirou went to school to hopefully formulate a better game plan and inform Rin of Shinji's defeat. Rin decided that both of them should speak after the school day has ended so they may have more privacy, especially since all the other masters they have faced so far have been either kid's(Illya) and teenagers(Shinji).

Rin and Shirou mostly avoided each other for the day to reduce signs that they may have a alliance, however this gave Shinji his much needed opportunity to finally prove himself to his Grandfather.

While Shirou was fixing a broken door hinge a few minutes after school ended he was confronted by Shinji for the second time, but without servants.
"Emiya!" Shinji said with a fake smile.

"Shinji, What is it?" Shirou responded with no small amount of suspicion. "Why emiya, I simply wanted to talk about the War and it's participants." Shinji explained before taking a strained breath. Now that Shirou noticed, Shinji looked more tired and ever so slightly pale for some reason.

"What About the other masters; and for that matter, why would you help me?" Shirou said, making his suspicion known.

"Emiya, as a fellow magus, you should understand the willingness to fight and kill for you desire yes? I nearly am here to aid you so that a...uh decent person wins the grail and not someone of a cruel and e-evil nature gains it's power"

Shinji's pauses didn't go unnoticed by Shirou and only reinforced his belief that Shinji was up to something. Fellow magus? Shinji needed a form of medium, like the book he had, to command his servant didn't he? If he had magecraft he wouldn't have needed it.

"Cruel nature? You put a bounded field over the school! You nearly killed Ayako for mana Last night! Shinji, What are you up to." Shirou said with clenched hands, ready to either fight or summon his servant if Shinji's happened to not be as dead as he though it was.

"Uh...well... Uh Emiya I-I just wanted to-"

Shinji paused as a cols feeling came over him, Zouken has run out of patience for him. The worry in Shinji's face disappeared and was replaced by a sort of resignment and...sadness?

"Emiya I want to prevent what happened at the end of the last war from happening again" "Shinji" said with a uncharacteristically sad expression on his face. Shirou on the other hand frozen on the spot.

"wha"
"Emiya you must know by now that the fire causes a massive amount of death and harm to many, I just want to prevent a repeat or rather, a even worse event from happening"

Shirou was still stunned, "What do you mean-"

Again "Shinji" cut him off, "At the apex of the War, Tokiomi Tohsaka and his Archer Servant had reached the grail but before he could use it, your father, Emiya Kiritsugu managed to injure Tokiomi before his Archer could rain a storm of swords on his servant. Kiritsugu's Saber, Your Saber, was ultimately defeated which made Tokiomi the last Master. Tokiomi was too injured for any healing magecraft and left the grail to his daughter Rin, instead he wished for the crippling and destruction of the families that had gotten in his way for the grail, The Einzbern Master and Matou master, Kariya, were killed and Kiritsugu was crippled by the fire.

Shirou' s mind was in overdrive. Rin's Father caused the fire and nearly killed Kiritsugu? All that death because he was a sore loser!?

"The wish wasn't just to kill the Masters that conspired against him, but to cripple the families, that's why the Einzbern Master is so young, why you nor Rin knew I was a Magus, and why my Grandfather isn't the participant for this war. His Magecraft and my magical potential were damaged beyond repair from it."

Shirou didn't know what to think or say. Could Tohsaka be trusted? Could Shinji? What he said made sense but... If it is, what was he supposed to do?

Shirou's confusion and doubt was clear across his face, he only needed just one more push.

"Our magecraft has become more like pure torture rather than a craft. The Familiars we use eat us from the inside out, draining our prana and causing unbearable pain. Sakura was to be the Matou Master but she simply couldnt bear anymore strain."

This managed to break Shirou out of his stupor, "Sakura is a Magus too? The wish affected her too..."

"yes...yes it did Shirou. That is why I wish to help you. The Einzbern, while victims, are selfish and would leave the others to rot and your father fought against the man who did this. You always had a habit of helping others and here you would prevent any future suffering for my family, for Sakura."

"..." Shirou was speechless, but "Shinji" already knew his anwser.

"Do you have a anwser...Emiya?"

Shirou looked up with a new resolve, to stop Rin, and Save everyone.

"Shinji, I accept your offer."
11233431.title: Tomorrow.

112334311.content:
Shirou was not a complete fool and nor was he stupid, he may be naive and too trusting of others, it was this trust that made it impossible for Shinji to turn him against Rin. Shinji’s chance to prove himself would come at a later date, for now he served as a meat puppet that Zouken used to speak with Shirou, to slowly win him over more so that by the time he arrived, he would be more Than ready for what’s to come.

Zouken could only smile with sadistic glee, even if this plan failed, it would be a proper motivator for Sakura in the next war that would surely happen sooner with the irregularity of its actions of recent.



When Shiloh arrived at the Matou residence, he was met with a disturbed feeling, as if this place was unnatural and perhaps dangerous. Shinji left the second his Grandfather cam out, something about reinforcing the areas defenses.

“Greeting, I’m-“ Shirou started.

“Emiya Shirou yes, I have heard much about you, but even then I am surprised you would accept our proposal.” Zouken said, interrupting Shirou. “You truly want to save others, do you”

“I...Yes, Yes I do.” Shirou said.

“Then I must warn you, you might already know but our Magecraft is currently flawed, it will cause great pain to you.” Zouken informed and warned, with seemingly genuine concerns.

“I know, but I will do what I must to ensure no one suffers because of this war, not again.” Shirou said, his face a determined mask.

“I see.”

“But before we begin, may I ask whether Sakura was a magus?” Shirou questioned.

“Yes, yes she was.“ Zouken answered. “In fact she was the one to summon Rider, but it came with a toll she pays even now. She will be indisposed for the remainder of the war. Would you like to see her? She is in a form of coma that she will awaken from, likely near the end of the war.”

“No, as long as she is safe we can begin sir.” Shirou replied.

“Please Emiya, Call me Zouken” Said Zouken. The ‘storage’ worms were ready and close to death, he would need to start within the hour or change worms.

113111.content:
Shirou Emiya hummed a merry tune as he swept the floor that the chess club had used. Once again he was staying late after school cleaning up. The chess club had asked if he would be willing to clean up their room after school and he couldn't say no to them. They had been willing to pay him, but he declined, saying that they didn't need to do anything.

As he was sweeping the room something red caught his eye. He crouched down and saw a red chess piece. He picked it up and studied it in his hand. It was an ornate king piece with a hint of flair to the crown. the middle of the piece had intricate red lines crisscrossing above the base.

But that wasn't what caught his attention the most. He wasn't a great Magus by any means, but even he could feel the power that coursed through the chess piece.

Shirou he could feel his circuits come to life and pour his prana into the chess piece. The moment his prana entered the chess piece it shattered in his hand harmlessly. Shirou jumped back in surprise, dropping the broom onto the ground.

He looked over where had stood and didn't see any sign of the chess piece or even dust of where it had once been. He couldn't feel any of the power that radiated off the chess piece. As if it was never here in the first place.

He picked up the broom and got back to work cleaning the room. There was still so much that he needed to if he was going to make it back home before it got dark.

Little did Shirou know was that the power of the chess piece wasn't gone. It had merely moved into a new container himself.

His grandfather had instructed him to place that chess piece somewhere that Emiya would be able to find it. He said that the chess piece would help the Matou family as a whole. He ordered Shinji to stay close by and observe Emiya and not to reveal himself until after it was found. After it was then he could do as he pleases.

Tracing was the ultimate magecraft of Shirou Emiya. It was a superior brand of Projection magic that was capable of Projecting Noble Phantasms, but, it was mostly only useful for tracing swords and other bladed weapons. Other projections take more effort and the type of magical weapon it is can render a item impossible to trace.

Such as Divine Weaponry.

The newly traced Phantasm in front of Shirou was non-other than The Eight-fold Blessing Of Amaterasu. Not only was it divine, but it was not even a true weapon, it was a mirror, not even a club, hammer or a shield, a mirror. it's power alone would be a problem to trace since it was EX-rank, a level of power incapable of being measured on the regular NP scale, even though it should be a low D-rank at the moment.

Shirou was as amazed that he could do it, even more so that he even knew it existed as all the weapons that he had seen from Gilgamesh's Gate and Archers past did not include such a sacred regalia.

The mirror hummed with a glistening energy that was entrancing and Shirou was starting to feel it. He didn't know why but he felt as if de-tracing would be a horrible mistake and felt compelled to keep the mirror around... for at least... just a little while.

14.title: Sieg

142.content: Who does he turn into?
142.title: Woman of the Fate Universe

1423.content: Who else do we have?
1423.title: Someone Else

15.content: Perhaps the one who goes through the transformation isn't one of our protagonists, but rather one of the antagonists?
15.title: Antagonists of Interests

info.brief_description: The Protagonists of the Fate Universe transform into various women
info.description:
The Nasuverse is filled with many different timelines and heroes and villains. The heroes and villains of those stories transform into women in one way or another.

The girls they turn into can be from the shows, games, crossovers, and even OC's. Just use good grammar and spelling. The only rule is that whoever you pick has to turn into a girl.

I will give a 100 points for actual chapters with good grammar and decent length.
